snippet.textDisplay:
@sonicadv27
Simply put, the tracks that can linked to him and his sound team are the ones that are replaced in S&K Collection, which amounts to ten (Carnival Night 1+2, IceCap 1+2, Launch Base 1+2, Competition Menu, S3 Act 1 Boss, S3 Knuckles' Theme and S3 Staff Roll).

Hydrocity being remade in Sonic Generations is ultimate proof that Hydrocity isn't MJ et al.'s b/c they're free to reuse it.

I think it's either Scirocco (who did cues for a "Stage 2" theme) or Sachio Ogawa (via The Hybrid Front
snippet.textOriginal:
@sonicadv27
Simply put, the tracks that can linked to him and his sound team are the ones that are replaced in S&K Collection, which amounts to ten (Carnival Night 1+2, IceCap 1+2, Launch Base 1+2, Competition Menu, S3 Act 1 Boss, S3 Knuckles' Theme and S3 Staff Roll).

Hydrocity being remade in Sonic Generations is ultimate proof that Hydrocity isn't MJ et al.'s b/c they're free to reuse it.

I think it's either Scirocco (who did cues for a "Stage 2" theme) or Sachio Ogawa (via The Hybrid Front

snippet.textDisplay:
@SeanSimX
Masayuki Nagao of the Sega Sound Team recently confirmed that this act of Hydrocity was arranged by him.  The original composer is still unknown, though.

snippet.textDisplay: @GiantSandles It's not... you're not getting mine. The fact that you like it or not, doesn't make it better or worst. THAT's why it depends on taste. If you think it's overrated is because you think it's taken better than it deserves to be taken. YOU're the one confusing words here.
snippet.textOriginal: @GiantSandles It's not... you're not getting mine. The fact that you like it or not, doesn't make it better or worst. THAT's why it depends on taste. If you think it's overrated is because you think it's taken better than it deserves to be taken. YOU're the one confusing words here.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Camposkpo You aren't getting it at all. I'll repeat my points. Saying a game is overrated is not the same as saying a game is bad - contrary to what you seem to imply. For example, I'd say Halo 3 is overrated. It's still a pretty good game, but not worth the average review score of 94 that it has.
Secondly, saying 'It's a good game' and then saying 'It depends on taste' is COMPLETELY self-contradictory. I really shouldn't need to explain myself on that one, so I won't.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Camposkpo You aren't getting it at all. I'll repeat my points. Saying a game is overrated is not the same as saying a game is bad - contrary to what you seem to imply. For example, I'd say Halo 3 is overrated. It's still a pretty good game, but not worth the average review score of 94 that it has.
Secondly, saying 'It's a good game' and then saying 'It depends on taste' is COMPLETELY self-contradictory. I really shouldn't need to explain myself on that one, so I won't.

snippet.textDisplay:
@GiantSandles > I'm aware of that, thank you =) and that's why I'm saying... good gameplay, good music, good graphics (even more for the age and resources)... as much as I see it... it IS a good game and it's NOT overrated... you just didn't like it that much. Also... I'm not retarded and I don't make retarded arguments =)

> Not at all... you said what overrated was, and that's why I was saying I got that point before of giving my opinion =)
snippet.textOriginal:
@GiantSandles > I'm aware of that, thank you =) and that's why I'm saying... good gameplay, good music, good graphics (even more for the age and resources)... as much as I see it... it IS a good game and it's NOT overrated... you just didn't like it that much. Also... I'm not retarded and I don't make retarded arguments =)

> Not at all... you said what overrated was, and that's why I was saying I got that point before of giving my opinion =)

snippet.textDisplay:
>If you think it was a good game, then it's NOT overrated.
Rating a game isn't as simple as black and white, you know. Games are normally rated on a 1-10 scale, not on a thumbs up and thumbs down rating system. So that line of argument is completely retarded in this case.
>You just said I was right, and that was precisely the point on saying that.
You seem to have missed my point. Juxtaposing the two statements together as I did, you must see that they completely negate each other, no?
snippet.textOriginal:
>If you think it was a good game, then it's NOT overrated.
Rating a game isn't as simple as black and white, you know. Games are normally rated on a 1-10 scale, not on a thumbs up and thumbs down rating system. So that line of argument is completely retarded in this case.
>You just said I was right, and that was precisely the point on saying that.
You seem to have missed my point. Juxtaposing the two statements together as I did, you must see that they completely negate each other, no?

snippet.textDisplay: Michael Jackson didn't compose most of his own tracks, certainly not the most famous ones. Moreover, if he did have any involvement (which I don't think he did) with any of the music, he chose not to put his name on the credits; that means he either didn't think much of the result, or was too embarassed by having his name attached to a videogame. Either way, you know what that means?  That means he gets no credit.
snippet.textOriginal: Michael Jackson didn't compose most of his own tracks, certainly not the most famous ones. Moreover, if he did have any involvement (which I don't think he did) with any of the music, he chose not to put his name on the credits; that means he either didn't think much of the result, or was too embarassed by having his name attached to a videogame. Either way, you know what that means?  That means he gets no credit.

snippet.textDisplay: I wouldn't say no more 3D Sonic games, because there were decent ones, Sonic Adventure 1 and 2 always come to mind but, still they had very bad glitches and problems throughout. I loved the running stages in Unleashed, what they need to do is use the same formula for the running stages they did in Unleashed and make a full game out of it with no stupid ass Gimmicks that Sonic Team is so fond of putting in Sonic these days.
